author: Alice Vincent
title: La La Land's unsung hero: meet Ryan Gosling's piano teacher
text:
A ctors learning musical instruments for roles is nothing new. Ever since the European fashion for composer biopics in the late Thirties (which reached the US with films such as Swanee River, about Stephen Foster, and Johann Strauss II picture The Great Waltz, both in 1938), movie stars have been wanting to gain authenticity and learn to tickle ivories themselves.
While Dirk Bogarde’s mastery of several challenging Liszt piano pieces set the bar high in Song Without End in 1961, hundreds of actors have taken up instruments in a matter of weeks before and since. Sometimes the level of dedication barely merits the screen time, such as when Rachel Weisz learned to master banjo, guitar, violin and accordion just for a 10-second-long scene in The Brothers Bloom .
